en_title: Transcript of media session by Secretary for Justice
zh_title: 律政司司長會見傳媒談話內容

en: Following is the transcript of remarks by the Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, at a media session after attending the Legislative Council meeting today (November 30):
Reporter: Mr Yuen, does it mean you have resigned because you did not say no? Does it mean you have already resigned?

Secretary for Justice: I don't think it's appropriate for me to comment on the question that has been raised, because given that there have been so many rumours, I don't want to create any more rumours, but one should not read my answer just now in Cantonese to mean yes or no. I think that would be the last thing that I would want you to do, nor is it the intention when I utter that answer. I hope that would clarify the position. I am sure you would have a lot of other interesting questions to ask apart from this one.
(Please also refer to the Chinese portion of the transcript.)
zh: 以下是律政司司長袁國強資深大律師今日（十一月三十日）出席立法會會議後，與傳媒談話的內容：
記者：司長，你是否已遞交辭職信？
律政司司長：直到今日為止，我都是希望可以盡量專注手上的工作。我相信大家都明白，其實現在律政司要處理的工作比較多，我亦很開心有一隊非常好的團隊同事幫手，所以到今時今日為止，我們都仍然會專注手頭上的工作。
（請同時參閱談話全文的英文部分。）
